questions.question: What is the Fourier Transform of the Dirac delta function?

answers.d: An impulse in the frequency domain.

explanations.a: A sinc function is the Fourier Transform of a rectangular pulse.
explanations.b: A Gaussian function in the time domain transforms into another Gaussian.
explanations.c: This is incorrect; the Fourier Transform of the Dirac delta is not constant.
explanations.d: The Dirac delta in the time domain corresponds to an impulse at all frequencies in the frequency domain.

questions.question: What is the significance of the duality property in the Fourier Transform?

answers.b: It allows the Fourier Transform of a signal to be obtained from its inverse.
answers.c: It relates time-domain multiplication to frequency-domain convolution.
answers.d: It explains how energy is conserved in the transform.

explanations.a: Convolution is simplified using the convolution property.
explanations.b: Duality enables symmetry between time and frequency domains for transforms.
explanations.c: This describes the convolution theorem, not duality.
explanations.d: Energy conservation is related to Parseval's theorem.

questions.question: What type of signal corresponds to a sinc function in the frequency domain?

explanations.a: A Gaussian transforms into another Gaussian.
explanations.b: The step function has a complex frequency domain representation.
explanations.c: A rectangular pulse in time results in a sinc function in frequency.
explanations.d: A cosine wave has delta functions at its positive and negative frequencies.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the Fourier Transform of a time-limited signal?

answers.a: A time-limited signal has a band-limited Fourier Transform.
answers.b: The Fourier Transform is always infinite in duration.
answers.c: The Fourier Transform has the same duration as the signal.
answers.d: The Fourier Transform is finite only for periodic signals.

explanations.a: The Fourier Transform of a time-limited signal is not band-limited; it spreads over all frequencies.
explanations.b: This statement is correct as the Fourier Transform of a time-limited signal typically has infinite duration.
explanations.c: Fourier Transforms do not have the same duration as the signal.
explanations.d: Fourier Transforms apply to any signal, not just periodic ones.

questions.question: What is the effect of multiplying a signal by a cosine wave in the time domain?

answers.a: It results in a band-pass filter effect.
answers.b: It shifts the signal's spectrum to a higher frequency.
answers.c: It convolves the signal with a sinc function in frequency.

explanations.a: This is incorrect; modulation does not create a band-pass effect directly.
explanations.b: Multiplying by a cosine modulates the signal, shifting its spectrum.
explanations.c: This applies to sampling, not modulation.
